intro: Combretum humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's combretum, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in savanna and forest-edge habitats, contributing to local biodiversity. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and birds, making it an ecologically significant species.
